title: Software Engineer (ROS)
description: Roles & Responsibilities . Architect & develop the software stack that support our control & navigation platform for autonomous ground robots . Work on the robot's control and navigational systems for mapping, localization, path planning, obstacle detection and avoidance . Work with IT team to develop system interface, loT modules, robotic solutions and customize business control system for mobile robots and AGVs . Build interfaces to our robots for managing and configuring our robot fleet and the data streams they generate . Define requirements and management of suppliers / external vendors . Provide system maintenace supportRequirements. Bachelor Degree / Master in electrical or electronic engineering, computer science, robotics or related field . 2 to 3 years of practical experience, ideally with experience of autonomous indoor mobile robots . Solid understanding of Linux enviroment and programming languages such as C++/Python/C . Understanding of control & drive systems such as differential, ackermann & omni-directional drive system . Experience with the Robot Operating System (ROS) . Well-versed in source control systems like Git . Highly motivated, proactive attitude and great communication skills . Must be comfortable working under tight schedules and multi-projects and ability to thrive in a small multidisciplinary group and collaborate with international colleagues . Fluency in English . Fresh graduate will be consider

title: NVM QRA ENGINEER
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesGQ - NVM QRA ENGINEER   Job Description As a NVM QRA Engineer in Global Quality, you will provide support for product qualification programs, assist with failure analysis and data analysis toward qualification of next-generation 3D NAND memory devices. In this role, you will coordinate with multiple engineering teams to ensure appropriate product quality/reliability evaluation methods are developed and followed. You will be responsible for developing and overseeing outgoing monitor plans. You will perform risk assessments and provide product disposition for manufacturing teams dealing with quality and reliability issues. You will also be asked to gain new product knowledge, as well as develop and mentor new talent.   Responsibilities and Tasks   Define qualification plans, manage qualification requirements, comprehend failures and rates within the scope of qualification, and perform risk assessments on all critical read points within the qualification plan. Coordinate with other groups such as Process Development, Product Engineering, Design, Manufacturing and other engineering teams involved in the qualification process. Provide release documentation upon achieving qualification and set up plans to monitor the quality and reliability of the products in the production phase. Coordinate with Research and Development and Product Engineering teams to help comprehend new reliability issues and how to test for and assess their impact to customer risk and reliability. Assist and consult on post qualification quality and reliability issues and assist in the analysis and disposition of these materials. Perform product failure analysis on rejects. RequirementsSkills and Experience  Rigorous use of statistical and analytical tools to help collect and resolve complex reliability and quality problems will be a fundamental aspect of this position. General knowledge of fab processing and device physics are required to be successful in this position. Ability to communicate clearly and concisely both verbally and in writing is critical in this role. Required to multitask and coordinate between multiple issues at any given time. Candidates with at least 2 years of experience in the semiconductor industry as QA or Product engineer are preferred.  Fresh graduates are welcome to apply    Education  A Bachelor or Masters Degree in Electrical Engineering or similar field of study

title: Change Management Engineering Assistant
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities :    Setup, maintain and troubleshoot the Company’s Enterprise Systems.   Define, implement, and enforce the use of business process that one is responsible or accountable for:   ensuring the business process that is effective and conforms to requirements.   ensuring that the processes are delivering their intended outputs.   reporting on business process performance and opportunities for improvement to management.   ensuring the promotion of internal and external customer focus throughout the organization.   ensuring the maintenance of the integrity of the business process when changes are planned and implemented.   ensuring customer requirements are met.     Document lessons learned and business rules for process control systems.   Perform data extraction and generate indices/reports.RequirementsQualifications    ·  Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively with a variety of people    ·  Basic PC skills including MS Office Word, Excel and PowerPoint   ·  Basic to intermediate data extraction, analysis and reporting skills   ·  Strong time management, organization and prioritization skills   ·  Self-motivated with a good work ethic and able to work effectively with minimal supervision   ·  Proven ability in multi-tasking projects   ·  Excellent verbal and written communication skills   ·  Flexible with job responsibilities and take the initiative to assume added responsibilities   ·  Successfully demonstrated teamwork skills with a strong focus on effective team dynamics   ·  Be flexible to work any shift    ·  Strong analytical problem solving skills

title: SAP GRC Consultant
description: Roles & Responsibilities Main duties and responsibilities of the successful candidates are to assist the Deputy Head/ Functional Leads on the maintenance and support of DES applications. This includes: Defect Management. Responsibilities include tracking of system defects reported by users; perform analysis and troubleshooting service to verify and confirm the cause of the problem; provide interim or workaround solutions when necessary to minimize disruption to operations; ensure prompt resolution to the defects reported and facilitate users in Problem Report (PR) testing. Service Request (SR) Management. Responsibilities include tracking and monitoring of SRs raised; assessment and implementation of SRs according to operating procedures, e.g. data patching requested by users. Change Request (CR) Management. Responsibilities include tracking and monitoring of CRs raised, conduct of impact assessment, design & implement solution and facilitate users in CR testing and conduct training when necessary. Operations Support. Responsibilities include monitoring and execution of scheduled events such as monthly jobs, financial year end activities, interface testing, support of audit-related activities, responding to calls/ emails from users about issues/ queries with regard to DES applications and provide on-site support when necessary; support scheduled events such as system down-time; investigate and resolve functional and/or performance related and/or integration issues. Prepare and submit monthly progress report on summary of the incidents raised and resolved, SR and CR status updates to the Deputy Head/ Functional Leads. Ensure the smooth operation of DES, including integration with other bolt-on applications, and interfaces with internal/ external interfaces so that the support is not disrupted during normal office working hours. Requirements Minimum 3 years of experiences in SAP Authorisation, covering at least 3 full SAP implementation cycles. Good understanding of Industry’s Best Practices and SAP Audit Guidelines. Must have knowledge of SAP Enterprise Portal (EP) and is able to setup EP roles.

Minimum 3 years of experience in maintenance of multi-landscape environments through client copies, system refreshes and transport management. Minimum 3 years of experience in analysis of system performance, database performance, and system health checks & implement tuning improvements. At least 1 full lifecycle SAP project/ implementation.

title: Treasury Director
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesFirm Overview: Blackstone is one of the world’s leading investment firms.  We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work.  We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems.  Our asset management businesses, with over $450 billion in assets under management, include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, credit, and secondary funds, all on a global basis.  To learn more about Blackstone, visit our website at www.blackstone.com.   Job Title: Treasury Capital Markets - Currency Trading & Risk Management, AVP   Job Description: The Capital Markets group is responsible for all credit and risk management initiatives within Blackstone’s Treasury Division. The central functions of the Capital Markets group are:  Measure, analyze, and control credit and market risk for the firm’s liquid investments Support liquidity, capital markets, and credit initiatives for the firm and its funds Contribute to overall balance sheet risk management for BX including the design and execution of FX hedging strategies    Responsibilities: BX is looking for an individual to be located in our Singapore office with a background in FX markets with an interest in gaining greater exposure to fixed income portfolio management, credit analysis, and capital markets in a dynamic corporate treasury environment. Primary responsibilities will include:  Execute FX transaction flow for Blackstone and its funds Partner with deal teams in analyzing FX hedging strategies for foreign currency investments Enhance FX risk management practices at BX and advise portfolio companies on FX hedging program construction Manage FX relationships for the firm and  its funds  across multiple counterparties, including managing the credit and KYC process Assist portfolio managers in conducting ad hoc analysis on portfolio performance, market opportunity, and future strategy development Construction and maintenance of fixed income portfolio risk analytics and performance reporting tools Build and maintain Excel-based models in support of investment and credit analytics as well as ad hoc corporate finance and capital markets projects Work cross functionally in support of technology development to streamline data aggregation in support of balance sheet risk management and reporting initiatives RequirementsQualifications: Blackstone seeks to hire individuals who are highly motivated, intelligent and have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors. In addition to strong analytical and quantitative skills, the successful candidate should have:  4-8 years of experience on an FX trading desk at an investment bank, large multinational corporation, insurance company or asset manager Strong understanding of corporate finance and hedge accounting principles Knowledge of and experience with fixed income and credit analysis Strong analytical, quantitative and communication skills Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal Advanced Excel, some experience with VBA and /or SQL is a plus Strong academic record in finance, accounting computer science, mathematics or some other quantitative discipline Strong work ethic; genuine intellectual curiosity & passion for excellence

title: FP&A Manager
description: Roles & Responsibilities Interface with external financial institutions or investors to provide financial data on group company investment or financing projects, and prepare financial analysis report as required; Work with China team on financial model and economic benefit analysis for company investment and financing project, summarize and prepare related work of project business plan; Support to conduct due diligence study on group company investment or financing projects; Prepare and review selected entity monthly/quarterly management reports, including overall P&L analysis, working capital analysis, business highlights etc.; Other ad hoc financial analysis or projects as assigned. Requirements Bachelor degree or above in finance or accounting related field, finance related certificates preferred; Minimum 3 years experience in TS department of Big 4 audit or cooperate finance experience is a plus; Able to work independently as well as in a team environment and under tight deadlines as needed Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Chinese, able to liaise with China counterparts. Good sense of financial data, active attitude and strong problem-solving ability; Strong logic thinking, good communication ability; Good command of MS Office applications and, strong EXCEL/PPT skills etc.; Experienced in ERP (Oracle) and ESSBASE (HFM) is preferred.
industry: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Banking and Finance, Professional Services

title: Tax Manager
description: Roles & Responsibilities Deliver a full range of tax services independently in compliance with laws and regulations within timeframe. Build relationships and interact with clients to provide excellent planning, consulting and expertise. Provide innovative tax planning and review complex income tax returns. Identify and mitigate tax risks. Manage tax provision and tax compliance process. Improve processes by developing or implementing best practices. Manage and coordinate tax audits. Maintain tax balances on general ledger. Prepare all tax papers in regular basis and handle all information data requests. Liaison with tax authorities competently on tax matters Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Accountancy or equivalent qualification.   Minimum of 5 to 8 years proven work experience as a tax manager or supervisor. Excellent knowledge of tax accounting, tax compliance. Excellent analytical, interpersonal, oral and written communication skills. Professionalism, dependability, integrity and trustworthiness combined with a cooperative attitude. Ability to work independently with limited guidance. Dedicated to superior client service. Strong organizational skill and attention to detail. Proficiency in Microsoft Office software programs, including spreadsheet programs (i.e. Excel) as well as tax software.

title: Quantitative Strategist
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a Quantitative Strategist at Virtu, you will be working on interdisciplinary teams alongside traders, quants and seasoned software engineers.  The environment is collegiate and collaborative, encouraging exposure to many teams across the globe. Responsibilities  Apply your observation skills and modern statistical methods to identify and build predictive models Research and implement new trading strategies Analyze existing strategies to identify potential improvements Develop risk models and frameworks to manage portfolio risks Create tools to automate research tasks and improve visualization of complex data sets RequirementsEducation, Qualifications and Experience:  Advanced degree (preferably PhD) in Science, Math, Engineering or other quantitative field History of diverse, challenging, and interesting coursework paired with a strong GPA Exceptional quantitative, mathematical, and problem-solving skills Great communication skills and the ability to collaborate with peers Ability to solve technical and or quantitative problems under pressure Ability to express ideas mathematically and algorithmically Programming skills (especially C/C++ and Python) Intellectually curious and self-motivated Ability to communicate within and across teams, at a high and low level, on both technical and non-technical subjects Ability to seek guidance and learn new skills from peers Extraordinary mental flexibility and a high tolerance for ambiguity Strong drive for success within a collaborative team

title: Operations Analyst
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOperations Analysts are a critical component of our trading team, serving an essential role to the operation and deployment of a high-performance electronic trading system in financial markets around the globe. Operations Analysts are responsible for the maintenance and improvement of the firm's pre and post-trade functions, requiring involvement in every aspect of the trading life-cycle; including pre-matching, settlements, corporate actions, cash and stock reconciliation, and cash management.  Our Operations Analysts also manage our profit and loss process; ensuring P&L, fees and financing are accurate.   During an intensive period of mentorship and training in trade floor operations, our Operation Analysts learn the intricacies of each step of the trade flow process. This team also has the opportunity to work closely with our Traders, Compliance Officers, Accountants and Software Engineers. They analyse trading data and look for ways to optimise processes to reduce costs and automate workflows.RequirementsEducation, Qualifications and Experience:  Strong academic background in math, computer science, business, finance or related fields. Excellent test scores and very high academic marks. Some programming experience required (Python and SQL is a huge plus). Ambitious and self-motivated, with the ability to use own initiative. Excellent problem solving and analytical skills; including effective troubleshooting in a fast paced, time critical environment. Strong communication (verbal and written), and excellent organizational skills are essential. No finance background is necessary.

title: Autocad Designer
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesFormwerkz Architects is seeking a creative and talented architectural CAD designer/technician who will work on a wide variety of design/drafting projects ranging from interior and exterior renderings, to floor plans and conceptual site planning to join our collaborative, creative and resourceful team.   Responsibilities:  Creating detailed 2D/3D schematics that are utilized in the construction of buildings and/or interior construction.  These detailed technical drawings incorporate the input of engineers, architects, designers and surveyors and can specify dimensions, codes, materials and production methods. Coordinating the collection of data and incorporating this information into drawings, schematics and maps. RequirementsQualifications:   Minimum 5 years of experience working in the interior design field with relevant qualifications. Ability to organize and put together the whole set of detail design drawings for commercial/hospitality architecture and interior design projects. Ability to work in a team to coordinate the CAD schematics/design development of the projects. Ability to understand drawings and design materials and have a good understanding of construction detailing and building sequencing. IT literate with experience using AutoCAD, Adobe Photoshop and Microsoft Office. Good organization skills and time management. Willingness to contribute to a high performing team. Previous experience specializing in the workplace sector/hospitality with FF&E experience will be highly regarded.
